alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following area, Cook. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 600 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall. - These storms are producing 1 to 2 inches of rain in less than hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Evanston, Skokie, Des Plaines, Berwyn, Mount Prospect, Oak Park, Glenview, Ohare Airport, Park Ridge, Northbrook, Niles, Austin, Irving Park, West Town, West Ridge, South Lawndale, Lake View and Lincoln Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
